alert.note: Alert for Gadsden; Jackson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 5:09PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Jackson, northwestern Gadsden, southwestern Decatur and south central Seminole Counties through 545 PM EDT/445 PM CDT/... At 508 PM EDT/408 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chattahoochee, or 17 miles west of Quincy. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chattahoochee, Sneads, Seminole State Park, Hardaway, Jinks, Sycamore, Hardin Heights, Rosedale, River Junction and Lake Seminole. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
